title: Merge Competing AI Teams Under One Leader
insight: Multiple elite AI teams create coordination overhead that eventually exceeds independence benefits. When teams duplicate infrastructure or compete for talent, force consolidation.
manifestations: Google DeepMind: Merged Brain + DeepMind under Hassabis (2,500 to 5,600 people)
Tencent: Unified scattered AI teams under Chief AI Scientist reporting to CEO
Meta: Created Superintelligence Labs, restructured FAIR under new leadership
test: Do you have 2+ AI teams building similar infrastructure or recruiting from the same talent pool? If yes, coordination costs are probably exceeding independence benefits.
whenNotToUse: When teams are genuinely exploring different technical approaches where premature convergence would kill optionality.
